member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger
member.summary: Dangling links are caused by errors occuring at the end of read. This class implements the methods for detecting dangling links and removing the nodes on dangling links from the graph. This also implements graph erosion, where ends of graph which have low coverage are removed.

member.name: F:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.erodeThreshold
member.summary: User Input Parameter Threshold for eroding low coverage ends.

member.name: F:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.danglingLinkLengths
member.summary: Field used to keep track of the minimum length of dangling link that crosses the length threshold. This is used to update the threshold for next round.

member.name: F:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.danglingLinkExtensionTasks
member.summary: Tasks queued to extend dangling links following graph clean-up after erosion.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DanglingLinksPurger class.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the algorithm.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of algorithm.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.LengthThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold length.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.ErodeGraphEnds(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: Erode ends of graph that have coverage less than given erodeThreshold. As optimization, we also check for dangling links and keeps track of the lengths of the links found. No removal is done at this step. This is done to get an idea of the different lengths at which to run the dangling links purger step. This method returns the lengths of dangling links found. Locks: Method only does reads. No locking necessary here.
member.returns: List of lengths of dangling links detected.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.DetectErroneousNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph)
member.summary: Detect nodes that are part of dangling links. Locks: Method only does reads. No locking necessary here or its callees.
member.returns: List of nodes in dangling links.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.RemoveErroneousNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Removes nodes that are part of dangling links.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.RemoveErodedNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph)
member.summary: Delete nodes marked for erosion. Update adjacent nodes to update their extension tables. After nodes are deleted, some new end-points might be created. We need to check for dangling links at these new points. This list is returned in the out parameter.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.RemoveLinkNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPath,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnNode})
member.summary: Removes nodes in link from the graph. Parallelization Note: Locks required here. We are modifying graph structure here.
member.param: Set of all nodes occurring at end of dangling links.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.GetPaths(System.Collections.Concurrent.BlockingCollection{Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPath})
member.summary: Gets the DebruijnPath from the specified blocking collection.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.TraceDanglingExtensionLink(System.Boolean,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPath,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starting from potential end of dangling link, trace back along extension edges in graph to find if it is a valid dangling link. Parallelization Note: No locks used in TraceDanglingLink. We only read graph structure here. No modifications are made.
member.param: Boolean indicating direction of dangling link.
Node that is next on the link.
member.returns: List of nodes in dangling link.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.CheckAndAddDanglingNode(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPath,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnNode,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Checks if 'node' can be added to 'link' without violating any conditions pertaining to dangling links. Returns null if loop is found or length exceeds threshold. Otherwise, adds node to link and returns.
member.param: Indicates if we have reached end of dangling link.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.ExtendDanglingLinks
member.summary: Try and extend previously terminated dangling links.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.DanglingLinksPurger.ExtendDanglingLink(System.Boolean,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPath,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnNode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Try and extend dangling links following graph clean-up after erosion.
member.param: Boolean indicating direction of dangling link.
Node that is next on the link.
Boolean indicating if last node in link has to be removed before extending.
member.returns: Length of dangling link found after extension.

member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.PadenaAssembly
member.summary: PadenaAssembly is the result of running Padena on a set input sequences. As part of assembled output, it gives contig and scaffold sequences.

member.summary: Gets or sets the associated documentation. The Documentation object is intended for tracking the history, provenance, and experimental context of a PadenaAssembly. The user can adopt any desired convention for use of this object.

member.summary: Gets list of contig sequences created by assembler.

member.summary: Gets the list of assembler scaffolds.

member.summary: Holds the de bruijn graph used for assembly process. Graph creation modules sets this, so that further steps can access this for modifications.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ParallelDeNovoAssembler class. Sets thresholds to default values. Also initializes instances implementing different steps.

member.name: E:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.StatusChanged
member.summary: Provides the status to the subscribers.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the current assembly algorithm used. This property returns the Name of our assembly algorithm i.e Parallel De Novo algorithm.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the current assembly algorithm used. This property returns a simple description of what Parallel De Novo class implements.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.KmerLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the kmer length.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.AllowKmerLengthEstimation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to estimate kmer length.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Graph
member.summary: Gets the assembler de-bruijn graph.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.DanglingLinksPurger
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that implements dangling links purging step.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.DanglingLinksThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold length for dangling link purger.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.AllowErosion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow erosion of the graph.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.ErosionThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold length for eroding low coverage graph ends. In case erosion step is not to be done, set this to 0. As an performance optimization in assembler process, erosion and dangling link purging step are done together in a single step. Note that because of this optimization, unless the danglingLinkPurger implements IGraphErodePurger, erosion will not be done irrespective of the threshold value provided.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.RedundantPathsPurger
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that implements redundant paths purging step.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.RedundantPathLengthThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the length threshold for redundant paths purger.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.LowCoverageContigPurger
member.summary: Gets or sets instance of class implementing Low coverage contig removal.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.AllowLowCoverageContigRemoval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable removal of low coverage contigs.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.ContigCoverageThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets Threshold used for removing low-coverage contigs.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.ContigBuilder
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that implements contig building step.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.ScaffoldBuilder
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance that implements scaffold building step.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.ScaffoldRedundancy
member.summary: Gets or sets value of redundancy for building scaffolds.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets the Depth for graph traversal in scaffold builder step.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.SequenceReads
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of sequence reads.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.EstimateKmerLength(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Bio.ISequence})
member.summary: For optimal graph formation, k-mer length should not be less than half the length of the longest input sequence and cannot be more than the length of the shortest input sequence. Reference for estimating kmerlength from reads: Supplement material from publication "ABySS: A parallel assembler for short read sequence data".

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Assemble(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Bio.ISequence})
member.summary: Assemble the list of sequence reads.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Assemble(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Bio.ISequence},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Assemble the list of sequence reads. Also performs the scaffold building step as part of assembly process.
member.param: Boolean indicating whether scaffold building step has to be run.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.Dispose
member.summary: Implements dispose to suppress GC finalize This is done as one of the methods uses ReadWriterLockSlim which extends IDisposable.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.EstimateDefaultThresholds
member.summary: Estimates and sets erosion and coverage threshold for contigs. Median value of kmer coverage is set as default value. Reference: ABySS Release Notes 1.1.1 - "The default threshold is the square root of the median k-mer coverage".

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.CreateGraph
member.summary: Step 1: Building k-mers from sequence reads Step 2: Build de bruijn graph for input set of k-mers. Sets the _assemblerGraph field.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.UnDangleGraph
member.summary: Step 3: Remove dangling links from graph.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.RemoveRedundancy
member.summary: Step 4: Remove redundant paths from graph.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.BuildContigs
member.summary: Step 5: Build contigs from de bruijn graph. If coverage threshold is set, remove low coverage contigs.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.ParallelDeNovoAssembler.BuildScaffolds(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Bio.ISequence})
member.summary: Step 6: Build scaffolds from contig list and paired reads.

member.summary: Dispose field instances.
member.param: If disposeManaged equals true, clean all resources.

T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger
member.summary: Redundant links are caused by single point mutations occuring in middle of reads. This class implements the methods for detecting redundant paths, and then removing all but one path.

member.summary: Threshold for length of redundant paths.

member.summary: Holds reference to assembler graph.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RedundantPathsPurger class. Takes user parameter for threshold.

member.summary: Gets the name of the algorithm.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.Description
member.summary: Gets the description of the algorithm.

member.name: P:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.LengthThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets threshold for length of redundant paths.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.DetectErroneousNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph)
member.summary: Detect nodes that are on redundant paths. Start from any node that has ambiguous (more than one) extensions. From this node, trace path for each extension until either they converge to a single node or threshold length is exceeded. In case they converge, we have a set of redundant paths. We pick the best path based on the kmer counts of the path nodes. All paths other than the best one are returned for removal. Locks: Method only does reads. No locking necessary here or its callees.
member.returns: List of path nodes to be deleted.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.RemoveErroneousNodes(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph,Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Removes nodes that are part of redundant paths.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.DetachBestPath(System.Collections.Generic.List{Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList})
member.summary: Extract best path from the list of paths in each cluster. Take off the best path from list and return rest of the paths for removal.
member.returns: List of path nodes to be removed.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.ExtractBestPath(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Extract best path from list of paths. For the current cluster of paths, return only those that should be removed.
member.returns: List of paths nodes to be deleted.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.GetBestPath(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Gets the best path from the list of diverging paths. Path that has maximum sum of 'count' of belonging k-mers is best. In case there are multiple 'best' paths, we arbitrarily return one of them.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.GetStartNode(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Gets start node of redundant path cluster All paths in input are part of a redundant path cluster So all of them have the same start and the end node. Return the first node of first path.
member.returns: Start node of redundant path cluster.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.GetEndNode(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList)
member.summary: Gets end node of redundant path cluster All paths in input are part of a redundant path cluster So all of them have the same start and the end node. Return the last node of first path.
member.returns: End node of redundant path cluster.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.RedundantPathsPurger.RemoveDuplicates(System.Collections.Generic.List{Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnPathList})
member.summary: Some set of paths will appear twice, one traced in forward direction and other in opposite. This method eliminate duplicates.

Traces diverging paths in given direction. For each path in the set of diverging paths, extend path by one node at a time. Continue this until all diverging paths converge to a single node or length threshold is exceeded. If paths converge, add path cluster containing list of redundant path nodes to list of redundant paths and return.
member.param: Node at starting point of divergence.

member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.Scaffold.DistanceCalculator
member.summary: Class calculates distance between contigs using mate pairs mapped to contigs. Reference: The Greedy Path-Merging Algorithm for contig Scaffolding: HUSON et al.

member.summary: Contigs and mate pairs mapping

member.summary: Calculates distance between contigs for each pair of Full Overlap.

member.summary: Bundles all valid mate pairs in single edge but considering ±3σ limit.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.Scaffold.DistanceCalculator.CalculateWeigthedEdge(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.Scaffold.ValidMatePair})
member.summary: Further estimates distances using weighted mean. and standard deviation by merging valid mate pairs.

member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.Scaffold.GraphScaffoldBuilder
member.summary: Generates Scaffolds using Graph. Algorithm: Step1: Generate contig overlap graph. Step2: Map Reads to contigs. Step3: Generate Contig Mate Pair Map. Step4: Filter Paired Reads. Step5: Distance Orientation. Step6: Trace Scaffold Paths. Step7: Assemble paths. Step8: Generate sequence of scaffolds.

member.summary: Number of paired read required to connect two contigs.

member.summary: Depth for graph traversal.

member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.Scaffold.OrientationBasedMatePairFilter
member.summary: Filter mate pairs based on support for contig orientation. The mate pairs support specific orientation of contigs, based on mapping of reverse read or forward read to specify orientation. Orientation 1 ----------) (------------- contig 1 contig 2 Orientation 2 ----------) (------------- contig 2 contig 1.

member.summary: Filter Paired Read Based on Orientation.
member.param: Map between contigs using mate pair information.

Number of mate pairs required to create a link between two contigs. Hierarchical Scaffolding With Bambus by: Mihai Pop, Daniel S. Kosack, Steven L. Salzberg Genome Research, Vol. 14, No. 1. (January 2004), pp. 149-159.

member.name: T:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder
member.summary: Class implements algorithm for extracting contig sequences from de bruijn graph. It detects simple paths in graph, and for each simple path in the graph, it generates corresponding sequence as a contig.

member.summary: Holds reference to assembler graph.

member.name: F:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder.coverageThreshold
member.summary: Holds value of the coverage threshold to be used for filtering contigs.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder.RemoveLowCoverageContigs(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph,System.Double)
member.summary: Build contigs from graph. For contigs whose coverage is less than the specified threshold, remove graph nodes belonging to them.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder.Build(Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Graph.DeBruijnGraph)
member.summary: Build contig sequences from the graph.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder.ExcludeAmbiguousExtensions
member.summary: For nodes that have more than one extension in either direction, mark the extensions invalid. For nodes that have palidromic sequence, all extensions are marked invalid. This is because for a palidromic sequence, left and right extensions are inter-changable and this causes ambiguity. Locks: No locks used as extensions are only marked invalid, not deleted. Write locks not used because in only possible conflict both threads will try to write same value to memory. So race is harmless.

member.name: M:Bio.Algorithms.Assembly.Padena.SimplePathContigBuilder.GetSimplePaths(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get simple paths in the graph.

member.param: List of graph nodes corresponding to contig path.
Indicates whether the contig sequences are to be created or not.

Next node on the path to be added.
